comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: Another view of Governor Bourke's statue in its 19th century location, along with the two Russian cannons, souvenirs of the Crimean War.

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: Here's another pic of the statue taken at about the same time, from a different angle - www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/2362659579/ ; and a close-up - www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/2696670735/ ; The statue was relocated in the earlier 20th century to a position outside the Mitchell Library. The cannons have since been banished to Centennial Park. Not sure what became of the dog.
